Description: Marble architectural (or possibly sculptural) fragment. Traces of red paint. Probably element of Ionian Archaic marble architecture.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably an arcitectural fragment. NA302 and NA303 are described by Koenigs (2007, 331) as elements of Ionian Archaic marble architecture.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.73) (Phase 3)
